review_title: Not The Place It Once Was, Very Sad
pros:
Taking care of children and families is very rewarding work. Wonderful coworkers. Great interaction with staff in other departments. Good benefits. Indoor parking. 
Magnet Nursing Excellence. Nursing scholarships for any employee wishing to pursue a degree in nursing.
cons: New CEO arrived several years ago and the entire system has gone downhill. Good leaders were let go and others were placed in senior admin roles who lack professionalism and leadership ability.  High turnover in departments goes unaddressed for years because senior leadership and HR are totally  aware but will not address the cause - ineffective supervisors, managers, directors. New talent won't stay as a result. They catch on fast. Workers suffer exhaustion trying to cover staff shortages. Work - life balance is very poor. This has had a trickle down effect as evidenced by CHW slipping in annual national pediatric hospital rankings.

review_title: The most toxic work environment I have ever been a part of.
pros: The vacation time and health insurance were nice.
cons:
Senior management and Human Resources wants absolutely nothing to do with overseeing the managers under them.  Bad managers are able to blame department level failures on individual subordinates instead of finding solutions to problems.  More than once I pointed out guidelines that endangered patient safety, put confidential patient data at risk or directly broke federal law and was ignored or blamed for instructions I had no control over.  
Unfortunately I have been informed that Glassdoor policy prohibits employees from providing the specific case number of the grievance that I lodged against the hospital so you have only my word to go on that eventually the hospital was found to be at fault and did everything in its power to resist having to change their policy until they were threatened with fines.
Beyond that, I have never witnessed nor spoken to anyone else who has any knowledge of a single instance in which a supervisor was told they were in the wrong when an employee tried to resolve an issue internally.

review_title: Good employees, bad managers in IT Department
pros: Most managers in the IT Department (IMS) don't know exactly what you are doing, so you have some control of your day-to-day interactions. If fact, some people can work from home one or two days/week, which is great.
cons: Managers are vindictive. They don't communicate, and it seems that they derive pleasure from writing people up (it is called placing people on PIPs). Some joke that managers have a contest to see how many people they can do this to. My former manager would write someone up so that others would work harder (motivation by intimidation). She is good friends with senior leaders so she is not going anywhere but up. The worst part is that she would gossip about others in the area, thus destroying her team. more than 50% turnover in 6 months and people don't care.

pros: The Mission. Most employees within the organization were talented, very friendly and easy to work with. I had worked in several areas of the health system. I would recommend any area other than IT.
cons: No opportunities for growth. Limited training and salaries below industry standard. Some managers were allowed to do anything they wanted, ethical or not. In an employee satisfaction survey that clearly pointed to a management problem, HR chose to do nothing. They didn’t even show up to the department meeting addressing the survey results; which is usually led by them. Worst HR department I've ever seen. They would much rather continue to hire new people than address real issues within management.

pros: CHW strives to have a really positive culture of inclusiveness and positivity. Depending on your manager, they can offer a really flexible work environment.
cons: The organization will proudly tell you they strive to be in exactly in the 50th percentile for compensation and benefits. Mediocre salary and benefits lead to having a mediocre staff.  The running theme from HR is that employees are so lucky to work for CHW, rather than CHW being lucky to have great people. So, they will mercilessly hit you up to donate back to the hospital multiple times a year. It's really aggressive. Their desire to build consensus also prevents meaningful change.

pros: The mission, knowing that you are supporting the amazing care provided to children.  No matter how bad things are at work it is hard to leave a place that does such wonderful work with children.
cons: It is no longer about the kids, families, caregivers and staff who support them.  Most senior level leaders that made CHW the number 3 children's hospital in the country are gone, leaving a gap in the commitment to the mission that made CHW such an amazing place.  There have been additional levels of management added and positions of front line staff eliminated, which has impacted moral and ability to deliver the same level of excellence.  Focus has moved from Kids, and Families and if feels more like big business.  Staff in IT were  told they could easily be replaced and treated with a lack of respect; this led to a huge loss of talent.

pros: Career Opportunities. Salary depending on the department, some people in supervisory positions make far less than the average.
cons: Children's attempts to have a positive culture. Children's unfortunately, falls short due to several long time employees. Often it's hard to change the minds and behavior of adults and it showed working at Children's Wisconsin over 5 years. I don't see it as much the fault of top execs but more so many middle managers. There's a lot of cliquey individuals, additionally, department heads seem to consistently not want to collaborate. There were times when I had a valid concern and brought it to human resources where my concerns weren't heard.

review_title: Unused Talents/Lack of Vision - IMS Division
job_title: Technical Expert in West Allis, WI
pros: Since the IT department is a bit behind the technological times, moderate competence places you in a good light. The IT department has recently moved from several locations to West Allis, WI, and the new space is nice. It is easier to paint walls and purchase nice furniture than to change culture.
cons: This only pertains to the IT department: Their is a divide between management and technical experts. While there are a few IT managers with a great deal of IT knowledge, recent promotions have elevated managers with less technical or analytical prowess.

pros:
Love working with kids and families!!!!

Pay is acceptable
cons:
Nurses here are unbelievable cliquey and judgmental!  

The culture on many of the floors is negative.  It's hard to have good teamwork with the "greater than thou" attitude displayed by so many.
 
Management sucks. --Very two-faced and  love to create and/or be involved with drama.  They focus too much on the pettiness of staff when they should be focusing on the patients.

It's hard to move up and/or around in the organization.

I do not feel valued as an employee at all.

CHW should be a place people come to work because they love working with kids....it's too bad that many just come for the status.  It's unfortunate that there are not many options in Milwaukee to work in pediatrics besides CHW. 

From what I hear Children's used to be a wonderful place to work 10 years ago.  Its troubling the direction this organization is going it...

Poor communication between all involved agencies in BMCW

pros: Excellent clinical reputation and focus on the patients and families.   Top notch physicians  and research faculty.  Market competitive salary and benefits.   Mas market dominance for now.
cons: Despite significant Senior Leadership changes,  the culture is still dominated by long tenured leaders who are opposed to new ideas and suggestions.   Staff  numbers are continually watched in many areas and getting additional help is difficult if not impossible which causes under-staffing and high turnover.

pros: I love working here, the staff and patients are generally nice to work with.  I've worked on the inpatient as well as outpatient side of CHW and loved them both.  It's a teaching hospital so there are always students and staff are always learning as well.
cons: Health Insurance is costly, they got rid of their online concierge which is a downer, lower pay compared to surrounding hospitals

job_title: Family Case Manager in Milwaukee, WI
pros: Some of my favorite things about this agency included having good coworkers and relatively decent pay for a social work position.  There are a also a number of other positions within this agency if you want to have the chance to move around.
cons: There's an incredible amount of unpaid overtime given the nature of the job.  You also have to work with challenging clients, and you will not succeed in this position if you can't separate your emotions from your work.

Say they care about staff but they really dont

review_title: Children's Hospital of Wisconsin--A Great Place to Work
job_title: Pediatric Registered Nurse in Milwaukee, WI
pros: Children's Hospital of WI is a satisfying place to work.  The children and families appreciate the high-quality care that they receive when coming to the hospital.  This makes coming to work very easy.
cons: I don't agree with the management style at Children's Hospital.  The leaders are not very strong, and middle management has had little to no training in being an effective leader.  The hospital does not support or encourage advancement or seeking other opportunities within the system.

pros: I can’t think of one.
cons: Hostile work environment. Employees are repeatedly belittled in front of the department as well as HR. Many have been harassed to the point of quitting. Fatally sick family members have been compared to patients to guilt workers into not calling in sick or using bereavement. Raises are trash. Prepare to be overworked to the point of caregiver fatigue as well as receiving no recognition for your hard work. Be prepared to be treated like a robot because it is very obvious in this environment that you are replaceable. Supervisor couldn’t utilize workers or schedule correctly to save their life.

review_title: I have always loved working in healthcare, but Children's truly affirmed my love of helping people. Even little people.
pros: They genuinely care about their emplyees and are trained form the beginning to know that they are supported and encouraged.
cons: There is the main campus, which is located in Wauwatosa, but then they have two other hospital-within-a-hospital locations in Kenosha and Neenah, WI - All new employees go down to main campus for all their new hire orientation

review_title: Deceiving and Set Up For Failure
pros: My co-workers were extremely nice and willing to help when I asked for it. The benefits offered were great and of course helping sick children is a great feeling.
cons: This was supposed to be my dream job since I started radiology school in 2011. I worked hard to get the position and was ready to learn and do well as a CT technologist. I thought training was going fine until about 5 weeks into working there, I was told I was behind and my manager was 'very concerned'. I asked what I could have done better or what I could work on to get up to speed and wasn't given a straight answer, multiple times. I was only told to 'be more engaged and proactive.' I did everything I could in the following three weeks. Took extensive notes, asked for constant feedback (90% of the time it was positive), and scanned independently as much as possible. I figured with the feedback I was receiving, everything was fine. Little did I know, since no one decided to tell me, I was apparently FIVE weeks behind on training and where I should be. Once again my manager was of no help and resorted to threatening me of getting fired. There was no more I could do to improve. My question was, why didn't something happen sooner to ensure I would finish training on time? Why after three of training wasn't I told I wasn't up to speed yet, and asked what could be done to fix things and improve on things? Those were things not done. I was set up for failure. I felt as if I was thrown into the position and told to, 'figure it out'. I was also told I didn't know certain terms and things about the scanners which made me behind to. When I told my manager that no one had brought up those terms and I had no idea that I needed them, I was answered with, 'Someone MUST have mentioned them at least once. Maybe you don't remember.' No. I remember them NOT mentioning it. The topic was brushed away making me feel like it was my fault for just not 'knowing' that I needed to know all that. No help was offered to improve my skills and I was told that I was most likely going to be fired because I wasn't learning fast enough and they couldn't give me more training time even though I was only half way through training. It was a joke and I decided to resign. One comment made by my manager was that he felt that "No child would be safe alone with me and that I would do their exam safely."Followed by, "Not trying to be harsh, but.." EXTREMELY rude and unprofessional. You do NOT say that sort of thing to any employee no matter if that's what you think is true in you mind. I will take part responsibility for my training not going as well as it could have, but I will never take full responsibility.

job_title: Family Case Manager in Brookfield, WI
pros: Great experience opportunity, and wonderful coworkers.
cons: Terrible organization in the community services department, horrible training plan for new employees. I had real life cases before I was given enough training to be successful. I was given almost no shadowing opportunities and I had to find my own support during my training period. I was blindsided in a surprise HR meeting and told that the possibility of me being "let go" was high, even though I had nothing but good reviews from everyone I spoke with. My peers said I did a good job and my training specialist said I was right on track and doing well. When I was given constructive criticism I took it gracefully and made the appropriate changes. This company has completely unethical business practices. I was set up for failure and thrown under the bus. They don't care about their employees or about the people in the community that we serve.  This is supposed to be about making sure we better families' lives and make a positive impact to ensure children's safety in their home. How can that be possible if the company is allowing new employees to make decisions when they haven't gone through all the training and aren't given the support they need.

review_title: The Best and Safest Car for Kids and. Great Place to Work!
job_title: Pediatric Registered Nurse II in Wauwatosa, WI
pros: CHW is the largest pediatric hospital in Wisconsin with the capability of serving 300 or more in-patients. It is a level 1 trauma center, has an award winning NICU, and an award winning congenital cardiac care program as well as award winning cancer care. CHW has competitive wages, a great benefit package, a collective desire to give the best and safest care to children. CHW is a Magnet Award winner three times in succession which is a distinction held by only 1% of pediatric hospitals in the country. CHW is on the cutting edge in many areas and is always looking for what is going to benefit the patients first and improve the efficiency and work environment for the employee. The employees at CHW are some of the most talented and compassionate people in health care. An amazing place to work where miracles happen everyday! I have worked at CHW for 18 years.
cons: The sick leave policy needs to be revised as the current one is very limited considering the employees are exposed to many illnesses each work day, as well as outside of work and are expected to come into work unless they have a fever or doctor's excuse. This policy potentially exposes patients that are already comprmised and their family members, as well as coworkers to unnecessary illness. An employee is only allowed 3 occurrences a year without being put on notice, then 2 additional occurrences through out the year before this may adversely effect their performance review. Being tardy will also add up your occurrences as they are lumped into one category. Each time an employee is tardy it is 1/2 of an occurrence.

review_title: Great co-workers and mission, Foundation leadership awful
pros: In my nearly 10 years at CHW, I worked with some of the most exceptional people I have encountered in my professional life and the mission is wonderful.
cons: The Foundation leadership is the worst I have encountered. It’s truly people that cause you to leave a job. The compensation wasn’t great, nor the work-life balance. But that was all offset by the mission and people with the exception of leadership.

review_title: Used to be Proud to say I worked for CHHS, but new leadership has DESTROYED this Hospital's Reputation!
pros:
Great Employee Benefits and at one time there were some Great People there to work with.
World Class Healthcare Facilities and partnerships and the potential to serve the children of Milwaukee and the world.
cons:
The OLD CHHS used to care about the KIDS and their Families First. Not anymore!
Most Senior Management is incompetant and were only hired due to politics or favors owned.
Much of the staff are overworked and undrepayed for their efforts.
Managements expectations are unrealistic and unobtainable due to their incompetance, leading to poor performance reviews and subsequently lower pay raises in order to meet their department budgets.

job_title: Site Manager in Port Washington, WI
pros: The mission of caring for children is the best out there. Being part of this mission is very rewarding. There are many great people that work at Children's which makes it appealing to work there.
cons: Leadership over the past 5 years has changed the environment to a negative and punitive place to work.  Employees are seen as tools rather than people and are treated without consistency or consideration. Over that past two years, there has been a trend to remove 8 out of 18 leaders in one entity alone, all with made up reasons. There is an expectation of loyalty for Children's but there is a lack of loyalty for employees. Very caustic place at this point.

job_title: Registered Nurse, BSN in Milwaukee, WI
pros: Great coworkers. Amazing patients and families. Ranked 19th in the nation so we get a lot of difficult cases and new studies. We are a teaching hospital. It is challenging and constantly evolving.
cons: We face a lot of tough losses. We still have an open chemo system so there is risk involved. Like any job, communication can be difficult between all levels of staff and providers.

pros: Leadership is focused on making you a better employee by providing advice and career development opportunities. Great benefits including free access to the hospital/clinic services and an excellent wellness program that promotes healthy living.
cons: Off-campus locations don't have all the same resources that the main campus does (i.e. dining, Alfred's etc.) and sometime parking at the main campus can be a pain if travel is needed often.

review_title: Great company to work for - leadership lives the mission.
pros:
Friendly environment; staff live "The Blue Kids Way" and hire to these core values. 
Great benefits
Nursing staff is paid very well in relation to local market - nursing leadership is paid higher than average.
cons: Not the best at growing their own talent - look externally for certain roles when it would make sense to leverage current talent and groom for next opportunity.

pros: Good place to work with friendly staff, training was adequate, and benefits are actually pretty good. Lots of new technology to work with..
cons: Pay scale is a little lower than other orginizations, and they know it. It can be difficult to work with sick kids if your in direct patient care.

pros: This hospital has so much potential and you can tell that the staff truly believe patient care comes first. I have worked within this facility, but in different positions, for more than 8 years. Everyone you run into is friendly and always willing to help you.
cons: Management can be on or off. I have had some amazing supervisors and I have had some novice management that could use some management education, but overall I do not see a lot of cons working here.

pros: I really enjoy what I do here, the people are great for the most part, the families that we help are fantastic for the most part(you've always got a few sour apples). Family day at the Zoo every year, PPL accrual is nice as well as the option to sell unused hours.
cons: Moving up within can be a challenge, HR is not very responsive, pay is less than other area hospitals, professional development opportunities are slim if you are not a doctor or a nurse.

pros: I have been with CHW for 5 years, and this company has given me the opportunity for career growth as well as educational assistance (both financially and working around my class schedule). I have worked for other healthcare companies in the area and none of them hold a candle to Children's. I absolutely LOVE it here!
cons: The only con I can think of is the pay differences, but Children's offers great benefits and in my experience take good care of their employees.

review_title: Stable place to work with reasonable benefits, top management focuses on themselves
pros: Helping sick children is rewarding work.  Benefits are reasonable -- good insurance options.  Generally stable employment.  Accessibly located.  Clean.  Employee wellness program is good.
cons: Management mostly cares about themselves.  Eliminated pension plan in favor of defined contribution plan.  Raises have been small.  Promotions can be difficult to obtain.

pros: The mission of CHW is hard to beat.  It is a very friendly culture.  Very positive.
cons: Salaries are at market or below.  Being a non-profit organization, they fall back on the "it's not about the money, it's about the kids" mentality.  To an extent, that is true.  However, when you need to compete for top talent in niche positions, sometimes it is a, at least a little bit, about the money.

review_title: Children's is a very welcoming place to work
job_title: Patient Service Representative in Wauwatosa, WI
pros: They will always try to be accommodating, central location, great way to see all the different jobs and job titles that all make the hospital be sufficient.
cons: The only Con I would say would be available hours, trying to fit in your FTE if you take off, and having to take paid vacation days even if you have your shift covered.

job_title: Family Support Specialist in Milwaukee, WI
pros: I helped to make a difference for the lives of  children in the foster care system.
cons: Long hours, stressful job (a given in the field of social work), very low pay.

review_title: Believe in our mission and a great place to work.
pros: CHW is a large, complex health system providing care to a diverse patient population in an increasingly competitive market. Key leaders understand the complexities and work tirelessly to make improvements. I'm proud to be part of the system.
cons: It's a large organization and communication is always a struggle. Also being non profit salaries aren't always competitive.

review_title: Great Company to work for as a student
job_title: Call Center Operator in Milwaukee, WI
pros: Flexibility in the work place while in grad school is a must for me.  Management has been very helpful with providing me with the support and flexibility I need while still in school. Even as a part timer, they offer great benefits like tuition reimbursement.
cons: Can not think of any

pros: good place to work for breastfeeding moms, they really support that.  Working with the kids is always fun. The support staff is really nice.
cons: little pay, they over work you, you have to do 20 jobs in one. some of the  doctors don`t appreciate you.

pros: The team is great. Senior leadership is great. Mid-level management is so-so.
cons: I am almost at the top of my pay scale with at least 20 years to retire. It's difficult to advance to a higher-paying clinical job unless it is a leadership position.

pros: Great integrity amongst staff, decent management. No major incentives other than differentials on shifts and weekend program nurses get twice yearly bonuses. Often lower salary than other hospitals in the area but worth it to me for no adult patients.
cons: Occasionally catty work place with high female worker to male ratio. Lots of mandatory hours, overtime and floating

pros: CHW uses some of the best analytics platforms in the healthcare industry and they pay to train their employees on these platforms.
cons: Analytics Management doesn't trust their employees, they have limited experience in the field, and they make poor decisions.

pros: They do great things for the kids. It made me proud to say I worked there for that reason alone.
cons: Way too political in the IT Dept. If you don't fall in line with ideas you know are not right you are alienated.

review_title: Great mission but serious management issues
pros: The mission!  The best part about working at Children's is that everything we do is for the kids.
cons: Too many levels of management.  Inconsistent decisions among teams in the same area.

review_title: definitely has great perks but work conditions getting worse
job_title: Registered Nurse II in Milwaukee, WI
pros: working with patient population, fulfilling, exposure to advanced and innovative healthcare and highly talented medical professionals
cons: pay, inadequate staffing, leadership,inconsistent, a

pros: There is usually hours you can pick up. There might be better departments however I had a particularly bad experience with this company. Hopefully it was just the department and location I was within in the hospital.
cons: There is a lot of drama, constantly. I never felt like I was supported by my "own" management. There is a lot of dishonesty within this organization. Employees get away with a lot and do not get penalized for their actions - management included.

pros: Dedicated to values, great location, caring community of professionals, great benefits, executive leadership committed to mission statement, safe place to work
cons: Little opportunity for promotion unless working in direct patient care, little to no support of work life balance, business not progressive with technology

job_title: Respiratory Care Practitioner in Milwaukee, WI
pros: Work with babies and children.
cons: Work/Life balance isn't very good, hard to receive time off, pay is lower than other hospitals, educational reimbursement is low, health premiums keep going up.

pros:
Great people to work with
We do everything for the kids
cons: Senior Management leads like they have no strategy or idea of where the organization is going.  IS leaders are fearful to ask the CIO to break down his requests and explain them.  Lay-offs occurred a few months ago.

pros:
Great community.
Great environment and facilities.
Many opportunities for advancement/change once inside the organization.
Enjoyed the feeling of working towards positive common goal (treating children).
cons: I did not personally experience this, but I have heard about some people's dissatisfaction with communication on some issues from senior management.

review_title: Best place to work where you can really make a difference in a child's life
pros: Great patient and family centered care in a teaching hospital.
cons: Long hours - tight staffing. Difficult to get time off.

pros: This is a great place to work with. I work with  professional staffs that have motivation to work hard and help each other.
cons: They don't open on weekend and I would like to work more days.

pros: It's easy to work at Children's because their mission is one anyone can get behind.  It's a family-friendly environment!
cons: Pay and benefits are not great. Benefits have gone and high-deductible plans are encouraged.

job_title: Registered Respiratory Therapist in Neenah, WI
pros: Wide scope of practice, transport team, competitive pay.
cons: Management is never consistent, turnover rate is very high. Lots of on call hours.

review_title: Really learn about your manager before taking a job here
pros: Great medical, dental, vision.  Great 401k match
cons:
Management doesn't take the time to get to know their employees and makes assumptions on career goals. Be prepared to change jobs based on organizational needs without having any say or input.
No holidays provided for office employees (have to take PTO if you want a holiday off).

job_title: Patient Access Representative in Milwaukee, WI
pros: The company has lots of part-time job, if you looking for a second job.
cons: They are hire a lot young people, who don't stay around for the long haul.

pros: Clean and safe environment. Caring employees. Great benefits. Potential to grow .
cons: The typical downsides of working in a hospital...i.e. seeing and working near sickness and disease.

pros: There is a somewhat flexible schedule
cons:
Unsupported by supervisors
Asked to do unethical things/deception
Told to do case manager's paperwork if they do not complete it in time
Clients do not matter; it's all about the numbers and making the agency look good

review_title: OK place to work.  Longevity is not appreciated
job_title: Registered Nurse Case Manager in Milwaukee, WI
pros: teamwork, caring for children, physicians respect nurses
cons: cannot use vacation time, management has a dictatorship mentality, lack of advancement,  poor communication,

pros:
Diversity
Benefits
Working as a team
Work hours
Ability to work more hours as needed
cons:
Communication is horrible
Unorganized
Favortism
Culture
Recognition for employees is not fair

job_title: Welcome Center Ambassador in Milwaukee, WI
pros: The people are great to work with and there is constant improvement at the hospital.
cons: There can be some confusion with scheduling, but otherwise it's not too bad.

review_title: Great place to work and grow your career
job_title: Senior Project Manager in Milwaukee, WI
pros: Strong culture of ethics and patient-centered care.  Children's treats their people well and promotes from within
cons: I can't think of any

review_title: Great people trying to make a difference
pros: The focus truly is the patient and the entire family
cons: 24 hour facility means crazy hours, high turnover in front line jobs

pros: Making a difference in the lives of children, awesome co-workers, great organization, room for growth
cons: Low pay, difficult seeing children injured or sick

job_title: Patient Care Tech in Milwaukee, WI
pros: Amazing benefits, great experience, wonderful staff.
cons: For me, it was an issue of distance. I loved the job.

pros: Great opportunities for employment and growth
cons: Quick turnover,  They do a lot of revamping,  with same Ideas

pros: Great work environment and friendly staff with a positive attitude.
cons: Inexperienced night shift on some floors.

pros: Great benefits and a lot of perks
cons: A lot of surveys completed to improve work environment but feedback from employees not implemented

job_title: Community Health Worker in Milwaukee, WI
pros:
Work life balance
Fair pay

Management needs work. 
Communication was lacking

pros: A lot of opportunities to try new things
cons: Health care is never on the cutting edge

pros: Great place , good benefits, nice management
cons: Good management and nice place to work

pros: Friendly work environment. Nursing concerns aren't ignored and nurses are also respected.
cons: Scheduling conflicts, can be hard to make changes.

pros: Good benefits, good people to work with.
cons: Management communications has been poorly related

pros: Culture is amazing, people are truly committed to their work
cons: Non-profit, not as many opportunities as for profit

review_title: Rewarding work, not so rewarding compensation
pros: Rewarding work and great coworkers
cons: Less than competitive salaries and benefits

pros: Great experience in the community
cons: Big case loads to manage. Too much turnover.

review_title: It's a great place to work
pros: Amazing place to work...great people, wonderful work environment
cons: Advancement opportunity is sometimes lacking

pros: Flexible schedule, good benefits, and good people

pros: Management is helpful in ensuring you succeed
